intro: Racosperma argyrotrichum, commonly known as the silver-haired acacia, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the Fabaceae family, characterized by its compound leaves and pod fruits. The plant is notable for its silvery-white hairs that cover its stems and young leaves, giving it a distinctive appearance. It typically grows in dry, sandy soils and is adapted to arid environments. Its flowers are usually yellow or pale green, and it plays a role in local ecosystems by providing nectar for pollinators.
